User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the Gia Đình Gắn Kết application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

role.description: Role of the user (e.g., parent, child).

points.description: Total points accumulated by the user.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task assigned to a child.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Task entity.

assignerId.description: Reference to User who assigned the task.

assigneeId.description: Reference to User who is assigned the task.

dueDate.description: The due date for completing the task.

status.description: Status of the task (e.g., todo, completed, approved).

points.description: Number of points awarded for completing the task.

Reward.title: Reward
Reward.description: Represents a reward that can be redeemed with points.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Reward entity.

costInPoints.description: Number of points required to redeem the reward.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image representing the reward.

Redemption.title: Redemption
Redemption.description: Represents a redemption of points for a reward or money.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Redemption entity.

userId.description: Reference to the User who made the redemption. (Relationship: User 1:N Redemption)

rewardId.description: Reference to the Reward that was redeemed (if applicable). (Relationship: Reward 1:N Redemption)

redemptionDate.description: Date and time when the redemption was made.

cashValue.description: Cash value of the redemption, if applicable.

description.description: Description of the cashValue or reward redeemed.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is refactored to nest `tasks` as a subcollection under the `users` document of the assignee. This enforces a clear ownership model where a user's tasks are located at `/users/{userId}/tasks/{taskId}`. This change simplifies security rules significantly by removing the need for `get()` calls to check roles, resolving persistent permission errors. Rules for tasks now check ownership via the path for the assignee and via a denormalized `assignerId` field for the assigner, which is more performant and secure. Collection group queries on `/tasks` are allowed for parents to view all tasks they've assigned.
